main event: A bright object with a smaller object around it was observed for about 20 minutes in the Pittsburgh area, Pennsylvania on June 19, 1965.
interesting points: The object moved southeast at about 20 mph and disappeared behind some trees, then later reappeared and disappeared again.
Two to three individuals saw similar objects in the Pittsburgh area on June 20, 1965, described as about the size of a car and silver-grey in color.
On June 21, 1965, an observer reported seeing a triangular object about half the size of a small pea that was silver in color, with four elements in a random pattern.
On July 21, 1965, another observer reported seeing a bright, circular object about the size of a half dollar, with smaller brighter objects around it.
Several observers reported the objects displaying unusual flight characteristics, such as stopping, turning, and disappearing.
sighted object: bright object with smaller object, silver or chrome spheres and triangular objects
